tweets.author: DiscussingFilm
tweets.text:
Disney has signed a deal with OpenAI & invested $1 billion into the company

Sora will now be able to AI generate videos based on animated, masked & creature characters from Disney, Marvel, Pixar & Star Wars

Curated selections of AI generated videos will be released on Disney+

tweets.author: Wetterschneider

Yep, exactly what we told everyone was going to happen is happening.

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text:
Yep, exactly what we told everyone was going to happen is happening.

AI generative software is just a mechanism to put the generation of mimicked output directly in the hands of the "money people". No auteurs needed, no crew, no craftspeople, no artists. No-one. 

Just a response to viewer metrics fed back into a system to generate more content.  

All the AIbros delightfully exclaining "democratization" and "anyone can be a film-maker now" don't seem to realize that they aren't needed either, in the end game. They are just beta-testers, churning out test cases and paying corporations to improve software they will soon no longer have access to.

They think actual artists aren't valuable but they refuse to see that they have even less to offer.  

Netflix is engineering a feedback system where 5%-10%-20% of its content is generated automatically based on viewer metrics. So is YouTube. They all are. No creatives in the pipe. And no "prompters" either. 

Prompters are even easier to replace with an LLM. And people will watch.

thread_replies.author: SCHIZALCOATL
thread_replies.text: Gunna blow ur mind here but you don’t actually have to watch disney netflix or youtube. No one is forcing you

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text:
I didn't suggest any such thing.

"People will watch" doesn't mean "People have to watch".

thread_replies.author: Ben2calderon
thread_replies.text: if people will watch, whats the problem?

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text: Really? Think about the question you're asking.

thread_replies.author: Lebnene Li
thread_replies.text:
These people failed to understand that if video and images are created automatically and without intention, it's worthless and the prompting phase is the easiest to replace. It's literally just noise and automated slop.

Any idea worth consuming/examining has to be worth creating

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text: I can't see how AIbros don't get this. ChatGPT already "outperforms" 99 percent of them. Even the most popular accounts in the community are using ChatGPT to write JSON prompts for them.

thread_replies.author: Richard K
thread_replies.text: Luckily we have the option of just not consuming the slop.

thread_replies.author: Chucky Gold
thread_replies.text: Your 100% correct! Most tech has always been nothing but a bait n switch. Once they get the majority of the people using it, they have full control, power and that pull the switch!

tweets.author: More Perfect Union
tweets.text: BREAKING: Disney is making a $1 billion investment in OpenAI, and will allow its iconic characters to be on the company's Sora AI video generator.

thread_replies.author: More Perfect Union
thread_replies.text:
"According to a joint statement released by the two companies, the three-year licensing agreement will allow people to create and share videos using 'more than 200' animated characters from Disney, Marvel, Pixar and Star Wars."

https://npr.org/2025/12/11/nx-s1-5640837/disney-openai-sora-deal….

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text:
Yep, exactly what we told everyone was going to happen is happening.

AI generative software is just a mechanism to put the generation of mimicked output directly in the hands of the "money people". No auteurs needed, no crew, no craftspeople, no artists. No-one. 

Just a

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text:
Yep, exactly what we told everyone was going to happen is happening.

AI generative software is just a mechanism to put the generation of mimicked output directly in the hands of the "money people". No auteurs needed, no crew, no craftspeople, no artists. No-one. 

Just a response to viewer metrics fed back into a system to generate more content.  

All the AIbros delightfully exclaining "democratization" and "anyone can be a film-maker now" don't seem to realize that they aren't needed either, in the end game. They are just beta-testers, churning out test cases and paying corporations to improve software they will soon no longer have access to.

They think actual artists aren't valuable but they refuse to see that they have even less to offer.  

Netflix is engineering a feedback system where 5%-10%-20% of its content is generated automatically based on viewer metrics. So is YouTube. They all are. No creatives in the pipe. And no "prompters" either. 

Prompters are even easier to replace with an LLM. And people will watch.

thread_replies.author: SCHIZALCOATL
thread_replies.text: Gunna blow ur mind here but you don’t actually have to watch disney netflix or youtube. No one is forcing you

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text:
I didn't suggest any such thing.

"People will watch" doesn't mean "People have to watch".

thread_replies.author: Ben2calderon
thread_replies.text: if people will watch, whats the problem?

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text: Really? Think about the question you're asking.

thread_replies.author: Lebnene Li
thread_replies.text:
These people failed to understand that if video and images are created automatically and without intention, it's worthless and the prompting phase is the easiest to replace. It's literally just noise and automated slop.

Any idea worth consuming/examining has to be worth creating

thread_replies.author: Wetterschneider
thread_replies.text: I can't see how AIbros don't get this. ChatGPT already "outperforms" 99 percent of them. Even the most popular accounts in the community are using ChatGPT to write JSON prompts for them.

thread_replies.author: Richard K
thread_replies.text: Luckily we have the option of just not consuming the slop.

thread_replies.author: Chucky Gold
thread_replies.text: Your 100% correct! Most tech has always been nothing but a bait n switch. Once they get the majority of the people using it, they have full control, power and that pull the switch!
